{"step_by_step_thinking": "The lymphatic drainage of the tongue is divided into four main groups: the marginal, central, dorsal, and ventral lymph vessels. The marginal lymph vessels drain the edges of the tongue, the central lymph vessels drain the central part of the tongue, the dorsal lymph vessels drain the back of the tongue, and the ventral lymph vessels drain the underside of the tongue. The posterior is not a term used to describe a group of lymph vessels that drain the tongue.", "answer_choice": "C. Posterior"}
